goals.question: What is the distribution of goals scored by teams in the league?
goals.visualization: Histogram of goals scored by teams
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of goals scored by teams in the league and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between the number of passes made and the number of goals scored by a team?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of number of passes made vs number of goals scored
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a relationship between the number of passes made and the number of goals scored by a team.

goals.question: What is the distribution of player ratings in the league?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of player ratings in the league and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of yellow and red cards given to players in the league?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of yellow and red cards given to players
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of yellow and red cards given to players in the league and identify any trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of fouls committed by teams in the league?
goals.visualization: Histogram of number of fouls committed by teams
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of fouls committed by teams in the league and identify any outliers.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['goals'] = data['goals'].astype(int)
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.hist(data['goals'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.5)
    ax.axvline(data['goals'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    ax.axvline(data['goals'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of goals scored by teams in the league?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['passes'] = data['passes'].astype(float)
    data['goals'] = data['goals'].astype(float)
    plt.scatter(data['passes'], data['goals'], alpha=0.5)
    plt.xlabel('Number of passes made')
    plt.ylabel('Number of goals scored')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between the number of passes made and the number of goals scored by a team?')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['rating'] = pd.to_numeric(data['rating'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['rating'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.hist(data['rating'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.5)
    ax.axvline(data['rating'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['rating'].mean():.2f}")
    ax.axvline(data['rating'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['rating'].median():.2f}")
    ax.set_xlabel('Player Rating')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of player ratings in the league?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['total_cards'] = data['yellow_cards'] + data['red_cards']
    data = data.groupby('team_name')['yellow_cards', 'red_cards', 'total_cards'].sum().reset_index()
    data = data.sort_values(by='total_cards', ascending=False)
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.bar(data['team_name'], data['yellow_cards'], label='Yellow Cards')
    ax.bar(data['team_name'], data['red_cards'], bottom=data['yellow_cards'], label='Red Cards')
    ax.set_ylabel('Number of Cards')
    ax.set_xlabel('Team Name')
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of yellow and red cards given to players in the league?')
    ax.legend()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['fouls'] = data['fouls'].astype(int)
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.hist(data['fouls'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.5)
    ax.axvline(data['fouls'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    ax.axvline(data['fouls'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of fouls committed by teams in the league?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
